text: Happy to tell or show! With time, I assume that we will be able to replace some of it with HubSpot’s React UI, but for now the setup is just not strong enough, and we need full JS/CSS access.
Could also be another icon like this symbolising that it’s custom
Perfect! Thanks John. I’ll remove them from our GitIgnore then!
Any chance we will get a ‘graph’ component soon? Would love to add some pie / line charts in our CRM cards.
This is something we're looking into! :slightly_smiling_face:
for data that not already in HubSpot? Or mainly for data that's just really had to show in a report?
For data that we build using custom calculations based on associated records
So almost impossible to show in a report
yeah 100%
Understood. Do let me know if there's anything specific you wish you had in HubSpot UI and we can see what we can do there :+1:

Is there a way or possible to load an iframe embedded into the literal card as a component?
In other words wrapped the same but instead of a floating div modal, it just is right in the JSX?
unfortunately no, and this will probably never happen.
Is there some sort of security issue that this opens?
not really, more just goes against the beliefs of the team
Ah, understood. We have similar practices in other directions.
Thank you!
of course, <@U03FJQPSC0Y> would probably love to talk to you about what you're trying to do with the embedded iframes

I have the current iframe modal working just fine.
I just didn't know if it was possible to flatted in back into the site.
yeah 100%

We are pushing and pulling requests for estimation, estimations, quotes, etc.
This is just a middle ground quasi API the iframe loads.

But since not all data is really hard set in these different areas.
A preprocess is needed.

This way I can interface with our 3 internal systems from one point.
And then when we have final quotes, and the deal changes in some way I can reflect that back up to HubSpot.
Can you not interface with the other system through serverless functions?

1 directly yes that is the engine for some parts RFE/Estimates
1 No being down a chain of data/steps
And 1 other that I am loading into the iframe directly as a middle-man
ah yeah that's a bummer

This will work alright though and has an additive benefit to us internally at least that we can access this middle man level through HubSpot, and additionally direct (eventually if this ever becomes a requirement)

The problem truly is trying to Sync everything is not an option we want.
The estimation engine alone is a large and should stay indepentant system.

<@U06B6V23BGS> just trying to make sense of the conversation here. Is it right to conclude that you find having to use Serverless as an unnecessary middleware since you already have your own middleware setup? Or did I miss anything here?

And yes, I would love to dive into your use case to know where the problem is, iFrame is one solution, but there is more we could do too!
Hey <@U03FJQPSC0Y>, wanted to ask another question. Will custom crm cards for the conversation inbox come in any product updates soon?
I like this question a lot

Hey <@U05CAJG8D98> we have been discussing this internally, but we haven't committed to the timeline on this one. I will keep you posted on what comes up. Would you post your use case that we can use to for discussions?

Alright, while I have your attention here, tell us what type of graph are you looking to show, and what problems are you solving with that? (this is something we are actively looking into, but graphs are pandora's box, so more use cases we know, the better)
